basic.description: This seminar is designed to provide an advanced level introduction to the methodological field of World History based around the study of global problems, processes, patterns or issues.  The course will cover the major trends in historiography, examine the primary epistemological issues of World History, and explore how commodities, people and the environment serve as interesting and important methodological avenues.  This course will also engage with the various debates of world and transnational history, and consider many pragmatic and epistemological challenges to the field.  One term seminar; fall or winter.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: World and Transnational History
